Analyte(s): IgG antibodies against nuclear antigens (nRNP/Sm, Sm, SS-A (SS-A 60/Ro-52), SS-B, Scl-70, ribosomal P proteins)
Instrument(s)/Platform(s): Microwell plate reader capable of measuring OD at 450nm and at 620nm
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for EUROIMMUN Anti-ENA Pool ELISA (IgG), a qualitative immunoassay for detection of IgG antibodies against nuclear antigens in serum as an aid in autoimmune disease diagnosis.
Indications for Use Summary: Qualitative determination of IgG class antibodies against nuclear antigens (nRNP/Sm, Sm, SS-A (SS-A 60/Ro-52), SS-B, Scl-70, ribosomal P proteins) in human serum to aid in the diagnosis of mixed connective tissue disease, systemic lupus erythematosus, Sjögren's syndrome, and progressive systemic sclerosis in conjunction with other laboratory and clinical findings.
